channel.title: Comments on: CFID and CFToken are now httpOnly in CF 9.0.1 updater
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: Peter - no I don't see how this would cause any issues with CFGRID.
item.content:encoded: Peter – no I don’t see how this would cause any issues with CFGRID.

item.title: By: Peter Lorimer
item.dc:creator: Peter Lorimer
item.description: Could this issue cause CFGRID to stop populating from a query after the 9.0.1 update?
item.content:encoded: Could this issue cause CFGRID to stop populating from a query after the 9.0.1 update?

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: No this is for CF 9 only.

item.title: By: Knut
item.dc:creator: Knut
item.description:
You wrote: ...“-Dcoldfusion.sessioncookie.httponly=true”...
Does this also work in CF-8.0.1 ???
item.content:encoded:
You wrote: …“-Dcoldfusion.sessioncookie.httponly=true”…

Does this also work in CF-8.0.1 ???

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: You are right John, you can specify httpOnly per-cookie using the CFCOOKIE tag now!
item.content:encoded: You are right John, you can specify httpOnly per-cookie using the CFCOOKIE tag now!

item.title: By: John Sieber
item.dc:creator: John Sieber
item.description: I could be wrong, but I thought that I remembered reading that httpOnly attribute was added to the CFCOOKI tag in CF9. Thanks for the tip about adding httpOnly support for jSessionID&apos;s as well!
item.content:encoded: I could be wrong, but I thought that I remembered reading that httpOnly attribute was added to the CFCOOKI tag in CF9. Thanks for the tip about adding httpOnly support for jSessionID's as well!
